description: Master Cypress for modern web automation, including the Test Runner, commands, stubs, and debugging

slides.title: Introduction to Cypress
slides.content:
# Cypress üå≤

A next-generation front-end testing tool built for the modern web.

- **Fast**: Runs in the same loop as your app.
- **Reliable**: No more async sync issues.
- **Visual**: See exactly what happened at every step.

slides.title: The Cypress Architecture
slides.content:
# No WebDriver üö´

Unlike Selenium, Cypress runs **inside** the browser. This gives it native access to every object (DOM, window, storage, etc.).

slides.title: Your First Test
Queries & Actions
slides.content:
# Command Chain ‚õìÔ∏è

- **Queries**: `cy.get('.btn')`, `cy.contains('Login')`.
- **Actions**: `.click()`, `.type('hello')`, `.check()`.
- **Assertions**: `.should('be.visible')`, `.should('have.value', '7')`.

slides.quizQuestion: Where does Cypress run its test code?
quizOptions: Inside the browser alongside your app
slides.title: Architecture Quiz
slides.content: Execution context.

slides.title: Automatic Waiting
slides.content:
# Stability ‚öñÔ∏è

Cypress automatically waits for commands and assertions before moving on. 

- No more `cy.wait(5000)`!
- It retries assertions until they pass or timeout.

slides.title: Time Travel Debugging
slides.content:
# Rewind üïí

In the Cypress Test Runner, hover over commands in the metadata log to see a **snapshot** of exactly how the app looked at that moment.

slides.title: Folders & Files
slides.content:
# Folder Structure üìÇ

- `fixtures/`: Static data (JSON).
- `e2e/`: Your test files (Specs).
- `support/`: Custom commands & global setup.

slides.title: Configuration
Cypress Studio
slides.content:
# Recorder üé•

A visual tool that lets you interact with your app and automatically generates test code for you.

slides.title: Asynchronous Nature
slides.content:
# Commands are Promises? üé≠

Cypress commands are asynchronous and queued. They return a `Chainable` object, NOT the value itself.

> [!CAUTION]
> Don't use `const val = cy.get(...)`! Use `.then((val) => { ... })` instead.

slides.quizQuestion: Can you use the return value of a Cypress command directly in a variable (e.g., const x = cy.get('...'))?
quizOptions: No, they are queued and must be accessed via .then()

slides.title: Component Testing
slides.content:
# Beyond E2E üß©

Cypress can also test individual React, Vue, or Angular components in isolation with the same API.

slides.title: Screenshots & Videos
slides.content:
# Proof üì∏

When running in `cypress run` (Headless), Cypress automatically saves screenshots of failures and videos of every test run.

slides.title: Cypress Cloud
slides.content:
# Dashboard üå©Ô∏è

A web service that records your test runs in CI, provides analytics, and allows for parallel execution across multiple machines.
